intro: Phthirusa triplinervis, commonly known as the three-veined fern, is a species of fern characterized by its delicate, feathery fronds. It belongs to the family Dryopteridaceae and is native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plant exhibits a complex venation pattern, with three primary veins running along the length of each leaflet. Its rhizome is creeping and produces clusters of small, spore-bearing leaves. Phthirusa triplinervis thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
